TITLE: US lawmakers introduce bill to ban TikTok
SUMMARY: A trio of US lawmakers has introduced new legislation that aims to ban TikTok from operating in the United States.

TITLE: Why a growing number of states are cracking down on TikTok
SUMMARY: Two years after TikTok avoided a national ban in the United States, the popular short-form video app is now facing growing pushback at the state level.

TITLE: Blizzard tells China's 'World of Warcraft' fans to back up data as it seeks new partner
SUMMARY: "World of Warcraft" fans in China will have to back up their playing history as the distributor of the hit game winds down its agreement with Blizzard Entertainment.

TITLE: US government charges 8 social media influencers over alleged pump-and-dump scheme
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission has charged seven Twitter users and a podcaster in an alleged $100 million stock manipulation scheme run through social media, the agency said Wednesday.

TITLE: Twitter suspends account that tracked Musk's private jet, despite billionaire's 'free speech' pledge
SUMMARY: Twitter has suspended an account that tracked the location of Elon Musk's private jet. The suspension comes despite Musk last month tweeting, "My commitment to free speech extends even to not banning the account following my plane, even though that is a direct personal safety risk."

TITLE: Why Tom Brady, David Ortiz, Jimmy Fallon and other celebrities are getting sued over crypto
SUMMARY: With the implosion of Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX dominating the headlines, celebrities who hawked cryptocurrency are now finding themselves under fresh legal scrutiny.

TITLE: The real revelation from the 'Twitter Files': Content moderation is messy
SUMMARY: Before then-President Donald Trump was banned from Twitter after the Capitol riot last January, there was a debate among some employees about what to do with the company's most prominent and controversial user.

TITLE: An Ethiopian professor was murdered by a mob. A lawsuit alleges Facebook fueled the violence
SUMMARY: The son of an Ethiopian chemistry professor who was killed during unrest in the country last year has filed a lawsuit against Meta, Facebook's parent company, alleging that the social media platform is fueling viral hate and violence, harming people across eastern and southern Africa.

TITLE: Senate passes legislation to ban TikTok from US government devices
SUMMARY: The Senate passed legislation Wednesday evening to ban TikTok from US government devices, in a move designed to limit perceived information-security risks stemming from the social media app.

TITLE: Uber Eats launches robot delivery service in Miami
SUMMARY: The next time you order a meal from Uber Eats, it may be delivered by a robot -- at least if you live in Miami.

TITLE: Former employees suing Twitter over layoffs score an early victory
SUMMARY: A group of former employees suing Elon Musk's Twitter scored an early win Wednesday when a judge ordered the company to inform any laid-off staffers of the pending lawsuit. The move ensures workers will be better informed before they are required to sign a severance agreement that includes a release of legal claims.

TITLE: TikTok may push potentially harmful content to teens within minutes, study finds
SUMMARY: TikTok may surface potentially harmful content related to suicide and eating disorders to teenagers within minutes of them creating an account, a new study suggests, likely adding to growing scrutiny of the app's impact on its youngest users.

TITLE: Tech groups ask Supreme Court to rule on hot-button Texas social media law
SUMMARY: Two technology industry groups asked the Supreme Court on Thursday to review a hotly debated Texas law restricting social media platforms' ability to moderate content, potentially opening the door to a sweeping reinterpretation of First Amendment precedent.

TITLE: Inventor of the world wide web wants us to reclaim our data from tech giants
SUMMARY: The internet has come a long way since Tim Berners-Lee created the world wide web in 1989. Now, with his startup Inrupt, he believes it's time for us to reclaim our personal data.

TITLE: 'There are red lines': Europe warns of sanctions after Twitter bans journalists
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's decision to suddenly ban prominent tech journalists from Twitter is fanning a fierce backlash in Europe.

TITLE: Elon Musk censors the press
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is no free speech warrior.

TITLE: TikTok might be too big to ban, no matter what lawmakers say
SUMMARY: In July 2020, the same month former President Donald Trump said he would ban TikTok in the United States, Callie Goodwin of Columbia, South Carolina, posted her first video on the app to promote the small business she had started out of her garage during the pandemic.

TITLE: Microsoft buys stake in London Stock Exchange owner in cloud data deal
SUMMARY: Microsoft is buying a 4% stake in the London Stock Exchange Group as part of a deal that will see the market operator spend at least $2.8 billion over 10 years on the software provider's cloud services.

TITLE: 'There are red lines': Elon Musk faces international outcry after Twitter bans journalists
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's decision to suddenly ban prominent tech journalists from Twitter is fanning a fierce backlash from lawmakers on both sides of the Atlantic.

TITLE: Amazon warehouse workers in UK vote to go on strike
SUMMARY: Amazon warehouse workers at a facility in the United Kingdom plan to go on strike, their union confirmed to CNN on Friday, in a move that's being billed as a first for the company's workers in the country.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Twitter blocked links to rival Mastodon. That could raise alarms among regulators
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's Twitter sparked an international outcry on Thursday by suspending a number of journalists at major news organizations who cover him.

TITLE: Listen up: Headphones are getting really weird
SUMMARY: When Huawei recently teased a new smartwatch in a promotional video, it featured an unusual design: the watch face flipped open to reveal a secret compartment where a pair of magnetic earbuds sat inside charging.

TITLE: Virtual reality titan John Carmack is leaving Meta
SUMMARY: Video game pioneer John Carmack is resigning from his consulting position at Meta with "mixed feelings" about the "end of his decade in VR," he announced in a Facebook post Friday.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Twitter bans links to other social media sites, including Facebook and emerging rivals
SUMMARY: Twitter will ban links to other social media services and suspend accounts that try to direct Twitter users to alternative platforms, the company announced Sunday, in an apparent attempt to stem user defections to competitors.

TITLE: Elon Musk says Twitter will ban some links to other social media sites, sparking backlash
SUMMARY: Twitter said Sunday it would ban links to other social media services and suspend accounts that try to direct users to alternative platforms, in an apparent attempt to stem user defections to competitors.

TITLE: Elon Musk says he will step down as Twitter CEO if voted out by a poll he tweeted
SUMMARY: Twitter's mercurial new boss may be out the door after less than two months on the job, if results of a Twitter poll go against him.

TITLE: Twitter deletes controversial new policy banning links to other social platforms
SUMMARY: Twitter deleted its controversial new policy on Sunday evening that had banned links to certain other social media platforms, less than 24 hours after the policy's initial introduction.

TITLE: Elon Musk voted out as CEO of Twitter by poll he created
SUMMARY: A Twitter poll created by Elon Musk asking whether he should "step down as head of Twitter" ended early Monday morning with most respondents voting in the affirmative.

TITLE: Elon Musk's poll results are in: He should step down, Twitter voters say
SUMMARY: A Twitter poll created by Elon Musk asking whether he should "step down as head of Twitter" ended early Monday morning with most respondents voting in the affirmative.

TITLE: Meta faces EU probe over antitrust concerns linked to Facebook Marketplace
SUMMARY: The European Union is investigating Facebook-parent Meta for possible antitrust violations stemming from the tight link between its core social media service and its online shopping platform, Facebook Marketplace.

TITLE: 'Fortnite' maker Epic Games to pay $520 million in record-breaking FTC settlement
SUMMARY: Epic Games, maker of the hit video game "Fortnite," has agreed to pay a total of $520 million to settle US government allegations that it misled millions of players, including children and teens, into making unintended purchases and that it violated a landmark federal children's privacy law.

TITLE: Here's who Elon Musk could pick to be Twitter's next CEO
SUMMARY: Elon Musk may soon be on the lookout for a new chief executive to run Twitter.

TITLE: TikTok is removing some of the mystery behind how it recommends videos to users
SUMMARY: If you've ever wondered why TikTok suggested a certain video in your feed, you may start to get a little more clarity.

TITLE: Brooklyn hospital network reverts to paper charts for weeks after cyberattack
SUMMARY: A network of three hospitals in Brooklyn, New York, has had to work off paper charts for weeks following a cyberattack on its computer systems in late November, the hospital group's chief executive told CNN Monday.

TITLE: As Twitter backlash grows, rival Mastodon reaches 2.5 million monthly users
SUMMARY: Twitter rival Mastodon has grown eight times its size in a matter of weeks, going from approximately 300,000 users in October to 2.5 million in November, according to a blog post by the platform's founder, Eugen Rochko.

TITLE: EU accepts Amazon commitments in antitrust agreement affecting data and sellers
SUMMARY: The European Union has struck a deal with Amazon that will resolve multiple antitrust investigations into the company and impose binding restrictions on the e-commerce giant's business, in another major step by EU officials to rein in Big Tech.

TITLE: After Twitter users voted to oust Elon Musk as CEO, he wants to change how polls work
SUMMARY: When Elon Musk polled Twitter users about whether to reinstate former President Donald Trump's account, he quickly followed through on the majority's wish to do so. "Vox Populi, Vox Dei," he pronounced via tweet, Latin for "the voice of the people is the voice of God."

TITLE: Zuckerberg weighed naming Cambridge Analytica as a concern in 2017, months before data leak was revealed
SUMMARY: Mark Zuckerberg considered disclosing in 2017 that Facebook was investigating "organizations like Cambridge Analytica" alongside Russian foreign intelligence actors as part of an election security assessment before ultimately removing the reference at his advisers' suggestion, according to a 2019 deposition conducted by the Securities and Exchange Commission and reviewed by CNN.

TITLE: Elon Musk says he will leave Twitter CEO role — but not right away
SUMMARY: Twitter owner Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday evening he will step down as the company's CEO, but only when he identifies a successor, directly addressing for the first time a Twitter poll he created this week in which millions of users voted for his ouster.

TITLE: Elon Musk says he will step down as Twitter CEO — once he finds a replacement
SUMMARY: Twitter owner Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday evening he will step down as the company's CEO, but only when he identifies a successor, directly addressing for the first time a Twitter poll he created this week in which millions of users voted for his ouster.

TITLE: Elon Musk's security team sought for questioning over incident he cited as reason to ban journalists
SUMMARY: Police in Southern California are looking to speak with Elon Musk and his security team over an alleged assault last week that Musk claimed involved a "crazy stalker" and led to the suspension of a private jet-tracking account on Twitter as well as several prominent journalists.

TITLE: Video gamers sue Microsoft in US court to stop Activision takeover
SUMMARY: Microsoft Corp was hit on Tuesday in US court with a private consumer lawsuit claiming the technology company's $69 billion bid to purchase "Call of Duty" maker Activision Blizzard Inc will unlawfully squelch competition in the video game industry.

TITLE: Twitter hit by legal complaints from 100 former employees following Musk's layoffs
SUMMARY: Twitter has been hit with allegations from 100 former employees affected by mass layoffs at the company, including that it unfairly laid off more women than men, terminated employees who were actively on medical or parental leave and reneged on promises related to severance pay.

TITLE: How virtual clothes could help solve fashion's waste problem
SUMMARY: The clothing industry is using digital tools to reduce waste and push fashion into the future.

TITLE: Washington moved fast to crack down on TikTok but has made little progress with Big Tech
SUMMARY: In a matter of days, the United States is expected to ban federal employees from downloading or using TikTok on government-issued phones or tablets, marking the country's broadest crackdown on the short-form video app to date.

TITLE: Some universities are now restricting TikTok access on campus
SUMMARY: A small but growing number of universities are now blocking access to TikTok on school-owned devices or WiFi networks, in the latest sign of a widening crackdown on the popular short-form video app.

TITLE: TikTok confirms that journalists' data was accessed by employees of its parent company
SUMMARY: TikTok parent company ByteDance has fired four employees who improperly accessed the personal data of two journalists on the platform, TikTok spokesperson Brooke Oberwetter confirmed to CNN Thursday.

TITLE: Twitter layoffs continue under Elon Musk
SUMMARY: Additional Twitter employees were terminated Thursday as part of ongoing, rolling layoffs under new owner Elon Musk, including from the public policy and media and entertainment teams, according to tweets from affected employees.

TITLE: Microsoft tells judges its $69 billion Activision deal would benefit gamers
SUMMARY: Microsoft Corp said on Thursday its $69 billion bid to buy "Call of Duty" maker Activision Blizzard would benefit gamers and gaming companies alike.

TITLE: The tech we couldn't live without in 2022
SUMMARY: Bone conduction headphones, TV streaming devices and Bluetooth speakers are among the tech gadgets topping holiday wish lists this year. Other notable products -- ahem, the new 14 Pro and 14 Pro Max -- are near impossible to find.

TITLE: Meta agrees to pay $725 million to settle lawsuit over Cambridge Analytica data leak
SUMMARY: Facebook parent company Meta has agreed to pay $725 million to settle a longstanding class action lawsuit accusing it of allowing Cambridge Analytica and other third parties to access private user information and misleading users about its privacy practices.

TITLE: TikTok might be too big to ban, no matter what lawmakers say
SUMMARY: In July 2020, the same month former President Donald Trump said he would ban TikTok in the United States, Callie Goodwin of Columbia, South Carolina, posted her first video on the app to promote the small business she had started out of her garage during the pandemic.

TITLE: US House bans TikTok from official devices
SUMMARY: TikTok has been banned from electronic devices managed by the US House of Representatives, according to an internal notice sent to House staff.
The US House of Representatives banned TikTok on official electronic devices, according to an internal notice sent to House staff. CNN's Josh Campbell reports.

TITLE: The year that brought Silicon Valley back down to earth
SUMMARY: On the first trading day of 2022, Apple hit a new milestone for the tech industry: the iPhone maker became the first publicly traded company to hit a $3 trillion market cap, with Microsoft and Google not far behind. As eye-popping as that valuation was, there were headlines speculating about how long it would be before Apple and its rivals topped $5 trillion.
